subject.name: Object Oriented Programming Using C++
subject.description: Introduces the principles and features of object-oriented programming using C++. Focuses on object-oriented concepts, class design, inheritance, polymorphism, operator overloading, templates, and exception handling for developing structured and reusable software systems.
objectives: To impart the basic concepts of Object Oriented Programming
To understand concepts about Classes and Data Abstraction
To understand basic concepts about Inheritance
To enable students to write algorithms for solving problems using object-oriented approach

units.title: Introduction to C++ and Object-Oriented Concepts
topics: Object-Oriented Technology and Advantages of OOP
Introduction to C++: Tokens, Keywords, Identifiers, and Data Types
Derived Data Types, Type Modifiers, and Typecasting
Operators, Constants, and Precedence of Operators

units.title: Control Structures and Functions
topics: Decision-making statements: if-else, nested if-else, switch, goto, break, continue
Functions in C++: User-defined and Built-in Functions
Function Parameters: Value, Reference, and Default Arguments

units.title: Classes and Data Abstraction
topics: Structure of a Class in C++
Member Functions, Accessor and Mutator Methods

units.title: Overloading, Templates, and Inheritance
topics: Virtual Base Class and Abstract Class
Member Function Overloading and Virtual Functions

units.title: Pointers, Arrays, and Exception Handling
topics: Void Pointers and Pointer to Class/Object
Exception Handling Techniques: Terminate, Fix Error and Continue, Log and Continue, Stack Unwinding
Design and Implementation of Exception Handling in C++

suggested_books: Thinking in C++, Volumes 1 & 2 by Bruce Eckel and Chuck Allison, Pearson Education
Mastering C++ by Venugopal, Tata McGraw Hill
Object Oriented Programming with C++ by E. Balaguruswamy, Tata McGraw Hill
Starting Out with Object Oriented Programming in C++ by Tony Gaddis, Wiley India
The C++ Programming Language by Bjarne Stroustrup, Pearson Education
C++ Primer by Stanley B. Lippman, Josee Lajoie, Pearson Education
Programming with C++ by Ravichandran, Tata McGraw Hill
C++ Programming Black Book by Steven Holzner, Dreamtech Press
